definition: to read aloud with expression/to recite/to declaim

sentences.english: We read books aloud a lot in our family.
sentences.chinese: 咱们的家人常大声朗诵书。

sentences.english: The background music for the recitation is a variation of the song "Ode to Red Flag".
sentences.chinese: 《红旗颂》的变奏是诗朗诵的音乐背景。

sentences.english: Ane-pal told me I should recite them and not look up the meaning of the words.
sentences.chinese: 一位网右告诉我应该朗诵诗歌，不要查去词义。

sentences.english: Was it because of the Quranic verses read in melodic background?
sentences.chinese: 难道是因为朗诵可兰经诗篇时有音乐伴奏吗？

sentences.english: Although born Bahai, he used to work as a reciter of the Quran.
sentences.chinese: 虽然出生巴哈，他利用工作作为古兰经朗诵家。

sentences.english: Ron Artest is dyslexic, agnostic, and an insomniac.
sentences.chinese: 阿泰是一个朗诵困难者，不可知论者和失眠患者。

sentences.english: Most of all, he is quite favored by the Muses. His poems have been elocuted several times.
sentences.chinese: 个人较受诗神偏爱，诗作曾多次被朗诵。

sentences.english: The executor relisting it out loud.
sentences.chinese: 遗言执行人把这段大声朗诵了进去。

sentences.english: It is elocnted in both Chinese and Engilsh.
sentences.chinese: 这是用中英文双语朗诵的。

sentences.english: She gave a recitation of a poem by Heine .
sentences.chinese: 她朗诵了海涅的一首诗。

sentences.english: People are used to going to poetry readings.
sentences.chinese: 人们习惯于去参加诗歌朗诵会。

sentences.english: Ali's recitation was so good that she gave three encores .
sentences.chinese: 阿丽的朗诵是那么好，她给三次叫好。

sentences.english: I finished and, to my surprise, the class broke out in applause.
sentences.chinese: 我朗诵完了，令我大为惊讶的是，全班掌声雷动。

sentences.english: She recited a long poem at the New Year's Eve entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 她在除夕晚会上朗诵了一首长诗。

sentences.english: MobileReciter is a Quran Reciter for mobile phones.
sentences.chinese: 移动朗诵者是一个移动电话古兰经吟诵。

sentences.english: Ladies or gentlemen, I give you we talker to tonight.
sentences.chinese: 女士们，男士们，让我向诸位介绍今晚的朗诵者。

definition: to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
(of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
